ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of middle ear surgeries (1993, 1997) and ossicular chain replacement; audiometry shows significant air-bone gap.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sloping high-frequency loss with no air-bone gap, consistent with presbycusis or prior noise exposure.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate current hearing thresholds and verify stability compared to the previous 2016 evaluation.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities to determine potential benefit from amplification.
To assess speech understanding in noise and establish a baseline for verification.
To identify specific listening needs and goals for amplification.
To verify that the hearing aids meet manufacturer specifications.
To verify that hearing aid gain and output match prescribed targets (NAL-NL1).
To ensure the maximum output of the hearing aids is not uncomfortable.
To validate improvement in speech understanding in noise with amplification.
To validate that the patient's specific listening goals have been addressed.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents for a hearing aid consultation. Audiometric testing confirms stable hearing compared to the 2016 evaluation. The right ear exhibits a severe-to-profound mixed hearing loss, while the left ear shows a high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss. Word recognition scores are excellent bilaterally, supporting the continued use of amplification.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe mixed loss at 250 Hz, rising to moderately severe at 3000 Hz, falling to profound mixed at 8000 Hz. Left ear: Normal at 250 Hz sloping to severe SNHL at 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT: 70 dB HL, WRS: 92% at 85 dB HL. Left SRT: 35 dB HL, WRS: 92% at 85 dB HL. Excellent recognition bilaterally.

proposed_items: Fit bilateral premium RIC hearing aids
Wireless remote microphone, TV streamer, and phone clip
Custom earmolds (SAV left, pressure vent right)
Real Ear Measures (REM) verification to NAL-NL1 targets
counseling_actions: Counsel on 'Bundled' vs 'Unbundled/Buying Group' financial models
Explain the 'Hybrid' model (bundled for warranty period, then unbundled)
Counsel on use and care of hearing aids, earmolds, and accessories
Instruction on pairing hearing aids with smartphone and manufacturer App
Discuss importance of verification (REM) and validation measures

escalation.rationale_short: Proceed with hearing aid selection and fitting as planned; no medical referral required as condition is stable.

follow_up_plan.objective: Hearing Aid Assessment (HAA) for fine-tuning, aided QuickSIN, COSI, and maintenance check.

expected_outcome: Patient elected to purchase hearing aids using the bundled model.
Aided QuickSIN: Significant improvement in aided performance (i.e., â€“3.5 dB Signal-to-Noise Ratio Hearing Loss [SNRHL]).
Aided LDLs: Judged as 'soft' at 50 dB SPL, 'comfortably loud' at 65 dB SPL, and 'loud, but OK' at 80 dB SPL.
Aided COSI: Patient reported hearing aids addressed desire for performance in noise ('much better' and 'most of the time').
Patient expressed satisfaction with the care and value of services provided.
